news.title: TikTok agrees to deal to cede control of US business to American investor group
news.summary: The deal closes a long-running drama in which U.S. authorities have sought to compel ByteDance to divest.

news.title: Apple becomes a debt collector with its new developer agreement
news.summary: Apple says it can now collect any money a developer owes the tech giant at any time.

news.title: Instacart to pay $60M to settle FTC claims it deceived consumers
news.summary: The federal agency alleged Instacart misled consumers with unlawful tactics, causing them to pay higher fees while also denying refunds.

news.title: ChatGPT launches an app store, lets developers know it’s open for business
news.summary: OpenAI is looking to populate its flagship chatbot with a host of new user experiences.

news.title: Pickle Robot adds Tesla veteran as first CFO
news.summary: Jeff Evanson recently joined Pickle Robot as the company's first CFO as the startup has allegedly expanded its partnership with UPS.

news.title: TikTok ban: all the news on the app’s shutdown and return in the US
news.summary: After briefly going dark in the US to comply with the divest-or-ban law targeting ByteDance that went into effect on January 19th, TikTok quickly came back online. news.title: The TikTok US sale is finally happening
news.summary: TikTok has finalized a deal to sell enough of its US business satisfy the divest-or-ban law, as initially reported by Axios, The Hollywood Reporter, and CNBC. news.title: These are the flying discs the government wants you to know about
news.summary: DiskSat's design offers "a power-to-weight ratio unmatched by traditional aluminum satellites."

news.title: Parasites plagued Roman soldiers at Hadrian’s Wall
news.summary: They were infected by roundworm, whipworm, and microscopic protozoans called Giardia duodenalis.

news.title: Trump commits to Moon landing by 2028, followed by a lunar outpost two years later
news.summary: Also, the Trump administration wants to put some nuclear power reactors there, too.

news.summary: Google loves AI content, except when it doesn't.

news.title: Peacock showing ads upon launch opens the door for more disruptive streaming ads
news.summary: Subscribers will start seeing ads when selecting a user next year.

news.title: Terrifying New Photos Emerge From the Jeffrey Epstein Estate
news.summary: The latest photo dump from Democrats in the House Oversight Committee includes more famous men and upsetting Lolita quotes written on a woman's body.

news.summary: Come See Me in the Good Light, Highest 2 Lowest, and F1: The Movie are just a few of the movies you should be watching on Apple TV this month.

news.title: Don't Miss This Kindle Sale: Paperwhite, Colorsoft, and Accessories
news.summary: If your favorite reader is the one left on your Christmas list, good news: Several Kindles and Kindle accessories are on sale right now for your last-minute shopping.

news.title: ICE Seeks Cyber Upgrade to Better Surveil and Investigate Its Employees
news.summary: The agency plans to renew a sweeping cybersecurity contract that includes expanded employee monitoring as the government escalates leak investigations and casts internal dissent as a threat.

news.title: The Ultra-Realistic AI Face Swapping Platform Driving Romance Scams
news.summary: Capable of creating “nearly perfect” face swaps during live video chats, Haotian has made millions, mainly via Telegram. But its main channel vanished after WIRED's inquiry into scammers using the app.
